posts.cooked: I’m a relatively new programmer, pretty alone on my team this year. I’m trying to modify REV 3in swerve code to work with analog encoders, and neos, as this is what my team had access to after breaking our REV absolute encoders. I am basing my module code off of: MAXSwerve-Java-Template/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/MAXSwerveModule.java at main · REVrobotics/MAXSwerve-Java-Template · GitHub , and we’ve gotten a lot of things to work, but one thing we can’t seem to get working is the twitch/turn back to zero or straight when we enable the robot. Can anyone help me see where I went wrong?

ohno:

analog encoders

What happens when you comment out syncEncoders(); ? I’m not too familiar with analog encoders but from what I’ve researched they work similar to absolute encoders in having their positions always being known, so you shouldn’t need to reset them. Instead have syncEncoders() sync the relative encoder and absolute encoder.

We do something like this, note this is for CANcoders, and will be different with analog encoders.
So you’re saying just replace my current SyncEncoders with a your syncRelativeToAbsoluteEncoder, modified for my absolute encoder? the original function of the SyncEncoders function was to do that.
I’d say yes, just because in syncEncoder(); doesn’t seem to actually sync the encoders.
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.cooked: from my current understanding, just doing something like this would also work though, just simpler:
alright, for some reason the modules work fine on test stand, but do not work on the field, they get misaligned after a reset.
Oh wow, it could be slipping? Maybe try updating from the analog encoder after a certain offset.
I don’t think it’s slipping? During normal operations outside of this on the field, the robot performs excellently.

That’s odd, I’d still try updating the wheels position from the analog encoder after some point but I think your problem is deeper than that. Is is possible that you have the gear ratios incorrect in your code base? That’d cause pretty massive issues.

I’d love to know what “misaligned after a reset” means, like once syncEncoders() is ran it starts misaligning?
